fields.description:
Reproduction:
1. Create custom fields with <script>alert(1)</script> in name and/or description.
2. Go to 'Field Configurations'
3. Click 'Add Field Configuration', enter any text in 'Name'
4. Hit okay and wait for the page to refresh
5. Choose the config you just made -> XSSed

fields.description:
I have created a ticket on another side, which was closed with the hint to reopen here.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35068

So here once more:
Customfield: Teams, Multiselect, associated to certain issue types, global context
Basic jql-query: --> more --> "Teams" is available in all criteria and has a red exclamation mark on the side, that states the Summery's text "... is not available ..."
Advanced search: query "Teams =" usually I get a list of available values, but I get nothing; when I provide a valid value for the custom field than the query is executed correct.
Probably this is connected to plugins, that I have been experimenting before this issue was reported first:
JIRA Toolkit Plugin - still active
JIRA Workflow Toolbox - deactivated
This issue is extremely uncomfortable for our users. What else can I provide to help solving the issue?
Thanks a lot!
Kr Wolfgang
JIRA (v6.0.7#6106-sha1:76d7c58)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to change "All of the following conditions" to "Any of the following conditions" and vice-versa for child conditions doesn't work in the transition editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit a transition with parent/child conditions in them, as per the attached screenshot.
# Attempt to change "Any to All" in the child criteria.

h3. Expected Results

It changes correctly.

h3. Actual Results

It goes back to what it was.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, the logic can be changed to use Any/All, as per the below example:

!Workaround.png!

h3. Notes

The parent criteria can be changed and this also causes another problem:

* When changing the parent criteria to "All" and publishing, it reports the child as "All". Upon editing it reverts back to "Any".
fields.summary: Unable to change "Any of the following conditions" to "All of the following conditions"

fields.description:
The initial upgrade to 6.1 went well.
However, upon restart the next day, I get the following error and cannot log into Jira:


The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started:

    Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-project-config-plugin)
    Embedded Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded)
    Gadget Dashboard Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard)
    Opensocial Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.opensocial)
    Gadget Directory Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.directory)
    Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets)


I followed the instructions found here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+does+not+Start+Due+to+Disabled+Bundled+Plugin but no dice.
fields.summary: Jira startup failing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35060].
  {panel}

In versions of JIRA up to 6.0.7, the workflow transition screen has had an 'All' tab, which showed conditions, validators and post-functions:
!workflow_alltab.png!
In JIRA 6.1 it has disappeared:
!workflow_noalltab_61.png!

Please can we have it back. The 'All' tab is useful for getting a quick picture of everything a transition does. It lends itself well to screenshots for documenting workflows too.
fields.summary: Bring back the 'All' tab in workflow transitions

fields.description: For freshly installed JIRA 6.1 getApplicationProperties().getString(APKeys.JIRA_ATTACHMENT_SIZE) will return null which results in incorrect messages, like: "The maximum file upload size is Unknown?." and break integrations like JIRA to JIRA Issue Copy which relay on this value present.
fields.summary: getApplicationProperties().getString(APKeys.JIRA_ATTACHMENT_SIZE) returns null

fields.summary: Bamboo integration stopped working after JIRA update to 6.1
As a Jira user, I would like to use @group to nolify all users of that group

fields.description:
Here is the step to reproduce: 
# Create two new issue types "limitcf" and "simplesearch" and create a new issue type scheme "limitcfissues".
# Create a new project "limitcfproject" by using the new issue type scheme.
# Create a customfield "company" and limit it to apply to those two new issue types and the new project.
# Create one issue.
# Open the issue navigator with Basic search mode, after choosing the project "limitcfproject" we can see that only two issue types are available but when you try to add the "company" customfield it is *not* available.
fields.summary: Project filter should affect the customfield availability on simple search

fields.description:
The attached screenshot shows the original situation from our user. The screen resolution is *1024 x 768* which is supported, but the user has toolbars that take space.

The problem only happen to issue link open dialog and it seem other dialogs show fine, which lead me thinking that the dialogs were designed to cope with small screens.

h4.Finding
* Happen in IE (8 & 9), FF and Safari if user have one toolbar.
* Happen in IE 10 if user have more than two toolbar.

h4.Workaround:
Please try ask the user to disable the view of the toolbar and it should be fine to use the issue linking dialog.
fields.summary: Link issue dialog not completely visible on 1024 x 768 screens in IE8 browser
Standardization of funktions in JIRA/Confluence (Vote/Like)
Version report chart should have configuration for the unestimated line
Can't click "(Access from 'Profile' menu)" to toggle checkbox on What's New In JIRA dialog
Improve the linking of Categories to Projects
DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager#getIssueTypeScreenScheme(Long) throws NPE on IssueTypeScreenScheme that does not exist.
Rename 'Summary' to 'Title'

fields.description:
When you add a custom field in JIRA 6.1 and go to advanced you see a Project Picker (multi select). In fact this the good old single select Project Picker. You should update the description back to reality. 

I had already [reported this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33146?focusedCommentId=516937&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-516937] in JRA-33146, but this was not fixed for the release (guess it was too late to fix).


Cheers
Holger
fields.summary: Wrong description for Project Picker custom field
Resolved Post Function > Generic Event (System) - Give Warning if Issue Resolved (System) event is populated
Allow administrators to turn off emoticons in OnDemand

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35036].
  {panel}

I18n message translation is broken for one of two gadgets in jira-timesheet-plugin in JIRA 6.1, reproduces with any 2.5.x plugin version and Mac OS or Ubuntu so far.

Both gadgets use the same i18n technique and both work fine and messages are resolved up to JIRA 6.0.8, however in JIRA 6.1 Pivot Gadget title and description messages are not resolved.

See https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue-attachment/419/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/1380096342.82/419/MSG_gadget.png

Steps to reproduce

1) Install jira-timesheet-plugin-2.5.6.jar (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/jira-timesheet-plugin/version/360)
2) Go to Administration - System - System Dashboard, click Add Gadget, type 'timesheet' (without quotes) in quick filter box:

Expect: Title and Description are resolved for both Timesheet and Project Pivot gadgets.

See also https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue/419/jira-61-__msg_gadgetprojectpivottitle__

fields.description:
Hello support!

To reproduce the bug do:
1. Create and store a MutableIssue with the IssueManager
2. change the status through WorkflowTransition
3. create an Issue instance of the MutableIssue with IssueManager.getIssueObject
4. create a Worklog instance with the Issue object as an input and use the WorklogManager.create method to persist the worklog
5. change the status of the MutableIssue through WorkflowTransition
6. create another worklog with the Issue object as an input and persists it

Expected is only another worklog entry but as a result the last status change is reseted (you can find an entry in the history tab about the occurrence).
fields.summary: Writting a worklog changes issues

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35031].
  {panel}

Hi,

I would like the following feature to be implemented in JIRA: tree-level issue menu

We have a lot of issue types that have similar prefix like 'Support: consulting', 'Support: technical issue'. Other issue types have different prefixes. When I select 'Issue Type' in 'Create Issue' window I have plain list. It could be great if I suffix acts as parent of tree and the rest of issue type name acts as leaf. So I may choose from the following tree:

Support
     \-- Consulting
     \-- Techincal Issue
Development
     \-- User Interface

and so on.

Best regards,
Alexander Afonyashin

fields.description:
We are running Jira version: v5.2.11 (#854-sha1:ef00d61)

Stand on an issue. Select 'More Actions'/'Log Work'.

In the 'Log Work' window: Select another date than the present (i.e. wish to log some hours that were executed yesterday), Fill out the rest of the form and then click 'Log'. 

Red error text appears underneath the 'Date Started' field: "You must specify a date on which the work occurred."

If you select todays date (do not touch the 'Date Started' field) then there is no problem and the work is logged. 

Workaround: Log hours on todays date and write in the text when it was done.

Is this fixed in a later version of Jira (has tried to search the JRA project for similar experiences) or can it be fixed?
fields.summary: Error when creating work log back in time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35027].
{panel}
{quote}
h3. Issue Summary
 * Customer would like to see local time zone format ie. CST, PST in issues
 * After applying correct configs in look and feel the correct format display in preview but not in issues. Correct format displays for .5 seconds in issue but then switches to GMT format
 * All users, all applications are seeing this issue
 * This issue occurs every time and is reproducible

h3. Environment
 * Reproduced in Jira versions 8.8.0, 8.8.3 and 8.7.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Look and Feel
 # Set timezone from default dd/MMM/yy h:mm a to dd/MMM/yy h:mm a, z
 # Click Update
 # The time zone then shows correct format with example: E.g. 22/May/07 10:55 PM, CDT

h3. Expected Results

When you go to issue you should see local time zone format displayed for created ie. CDT, PST
h3. Actual Results

Time zone format shows correct for .5 second then switches to GMT format

Setting 'z' at the end is the correct format needed since the correct local format is shown but only for a second and then switches to GMT format. Indicating this is suspicious bug behavior.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
{quote}
fields.summary: Date Time rendered Incorrectly for Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go into Issues > My Open Issues or Reported By Me.
# Set the Issue Navigator to Detail View.
# Select an issue, hit Edit.
# Make some changes (doesn't appear to matter what), then click Update.

Despite there being issues there previously, the Issue Navigator changes back to the "No issues were found to match your search" view. Clicking the magnifying glass to search again returns all of the issues to the navigator.

It _doesn't_ happen for user-saved filters, only ones where the filter ID in the URL is a negative number.

This occurs in Safari 6.0.5, Firefox 24.0, and Chrome 29.0.1547.76.
fields.summary: Editing an issue in Detail View when using the default "My Open Issues" or "Reported By Me" filter changes filter view to "No issues were found" upon save

(This affects JIRA "6.1-OD-9-WN" but that version isn't an available option.)

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two projects, ONE and TWO.
# Create an issue in each of those two projects, and add attachments to both.
# Change the project key of ONE to THREE, and notice the attachment on THREE-1 (previously ONE-1) works fine.
# Move TWO-1 to the newly-renamed project THREE, TWO-1 now becomes THREE-2.
# The attachment is no longer accessible from THREE-2, and JIRA spits out the following error in the logs:
{code:none}
/browse/THREE-2 [jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager] Error writing to thumbnail file: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/ONE/ONE-2/thumbs/_thumb_10901.png
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/ONE/ONE-2/10901 (No such file or directory)
{code}
fields.summary: Changing a project key then moving an issue with attachments into that newly-changed project causes the attachments on the issue to become unavailable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35018].
  {panel}

If a user is deleted from LDAP, if using a connector user directory on the next sync it will delete that user from JIRA. It doesn't appear this follows some of the inbuilt restrictions around deleting users in the GUI - for example you can delete a user from LDAP and it will remove them even if they're assigned issues. This can leave all sorts of orphaned information and cause problems.

Given we now have deactivate user functionality in JIRA, rather than deleting the user in JIRA can we deactivate the user? This would prevent us from getting into situations where deleting a user has caused problems in JIRA.

h3. Workaround

Deactivate the user in the LDAP engine and JIRA rather then deleting them.
fields.summary: Ability to detect a deleted user in LDAP and disable that user
"What's New" dialog should never show administrative changes

fields.description:
I am using JIRA version 5.0.4
I have created a select list field which is a default jira custom field (not provided by any plugin). Initially I have not added any options to the select list. When the page loads java script inserts options into the select list. But when I hit the create issue button I see the error 'Invalid value '10' passed for customfield 'Ptest4'. Allowed values are: , -1'.

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug
Under certain conditions, the Time Since Report would not show the report results, instead, it would throw a stack trace. The conditions are that the project running the report is new, and that the global language is set to Chinese.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new project in JIRA, and an issue in that new project
# Set the default language to be Chinese (you might need to download the translation pack for this)
# Access the Time Since Report (usually the last report in the list), and then try to generate the report
# You will face the following :

!Time Since.png|thumbnail!

h3. Other observations

* This only occurs in Chinese, but not in other languages (tested with Japanese, German, French and Spanish)
* A test with an existing project did not reproduce this error, seems to only affect new projects
fields.summary: Time Since Report faces errors under certain conditions

fields.description:
We're using JIRA 6.0.5. When I click the icon that says "A permanent link to a comment" that's displayed to the upper right of every comment I see this behavior (FF, Chrome and IE 10):

1) My browser follows the link, showing the issue and highlighting the comment

2) The URL shows the full link, but 200 msec later, the URL shortens to just show the issue ID.

- For example, the URL shortens from
-- https://jira.pnnl.gov/jira/browse/OMCDA-814?focusedCommentId=39731&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-39731
- To
-- https://jira.pnnl.gov/jira/browse/OMCDA-814

In previous versions (e.g. JIRA 5.1.8.) when I clicked the icon that says "A permanent link to a comment" JIRA created a permanent link to the comment, which included the comment id in the URL.

I assume this is a kind of regression bug.

Cheers
Kai

Parts of the description taken from [atlassian answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/202556/permanent-link-to-comment-url]

fields.description:
OBJECTIVE
Ability to create estimates and track progress are essential aspects of project management.
Transition from one state to another is a logical place in the workflow to force people to enter the time they spent on an issue.
Ironically, out of all fields, it's "Time Spent" that does not send events to server from transition screen.

SETUP
System = Download JIRA (v6.0.1#6096-sha1:e4a48bd)
"Time Spent" field info according to https://<my_jira_instance>/rest/api/2/field
{
"id": "timespent",
"name": "Time Spent",
"custom": false,
"orderable": false,
"navigable": true,
"searchable": false,
"schema": {
"type": "number",
"system": "timespent"
}
},

SYMPTOM:
JIRA Workflow Transition
Transition Screen: during transition, enter or change values in any system or custom field without clicking OK - AJAX evnets are sent to server (according to atlassian-jira.log)

"Time Spent" - enter any value - NO events are sent to server.

NOTE:
1. Atlassian Support ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-171807

2. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Bug+Fixing+Policy:
For non-critical bugs, the developer assigned to fixing bugs prioritises the non-critical bug according to these factors:
1) How many of our supported configurations are affected by the problem. [MV] - Jira OnDemand and Download, versions 5.x and 6.x
2) Whether there is an effective workaround or patch. [MV] - no workaround, effective or not.
3) How difficult the issue is to fix. [MV] - fast and easy, now impact to other functionality
4) Whether many bugs in one area can be fixed at one time. [MV] - TBD
fields.summary: "Time Spent" does not send Ajax events from transition screens

Setting jira.home in jira-application.properties still works, however. Tested on OpenIndiana with the Jira 6.1 standalone tarball release. Catalina.out is attached; the issue is 100% repeatable on this machine.
fields.summary: Jira 6.1 does not use JIRA_HOME environment variable

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Click on Issues dropdown from top bar, click on filter "My Open Issues" (or click from left sidebar link)
2. Choose a ticket from list (without changing search criteria)
3. Change status of ticket (eg, click "In Progress")
4. The list of issues disappears, and an empty search list with the same previous criteria is shown. (shown in screenshot). 

To get back to the list of issues, the query needs to be run again (e.g. press Enter or click "My Open Issues" again).\

The expected behaviour is that the issue that you were on (the one that no longer matches the query) disappears, and next issue in the list is selected.

The problem only happens when you're using a issue filter (e.g. "My Open Issues") to search for issues. If you use the same JQL *outside* of a filter the problem does not occur.
fields.summary: Changing an issue's status while using a filter displays empty page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34988].
  {panel}

When trying to separate projects into using a separate scheme for everything, as a user/ jira administrator I find that th field configurations and field configurations schemes by far the most confusing element possible .

What really throws me off is the screens that I see in the new project I am in process of creating! 

When I am looking at the new field configuration which is affected only to my new project, which has also a unique screen scheme with 1 single screen affected, I am seeing the multitiude of screens which are only relevant to other projects and even sometimes to some issue types which I do not have in this project. 

This is extremely confusing and even scary at first and even distracting. 
i.e I have to convince myself that the screens that appear in my brand new spanking Field configuration have no effect and that the things I do here will not affect the other field configuration. 

To relate my user experience, even after a few months of working extensively on configuring our JIRA for 3 different Projects, I find the 'multi project jira' really hard to configure. 

As another comment I'd suggest to have some kind of a new project creation wizard which could really simplify just how "separate" do you want this project to be from others (in terms of sharing or not the schemes with them), preferably in one or a handful off screens. 

Right now I'm dreading the day when I'll start configuring my next "separate"  project - I'll need to create 8 new schemes and several new configurations and go back and worth between System\Issues and Project\Administration to affect newly created schemes. 

Besides the wizard, there should be a really quick agile option create me a totally separate project with totally separate schemes and configs taking by default the name of the project so I do not have to create and  type Project X scheme 10 times... 

this is a major need, for I'd love to just create this totally separate project and just hand it over to a team leader so they configure to their heart's content and I would not have to worry that they mix up something in my other schemes because they forgot that they're sharing them with my other projects...
fields.summary: Field Configuration scheme should show only the screens applicable to the project

fields.description:
JIRA is not exiting cleanly and therefore renders the Tomcat shutdown.sh script malfunction. This needs to be fixed in order for JIRA restarts to be performed gracefully and no data corruption happens.


*Original request by the customer:*
In my experience with Jira (customer since v3.x), never once has shutdown.sh ever actually shut down tomcat. I propose that instead of having logic in the bash script to check to see if the process exited, you do one of the following:

* Issue a kill -9, because that's ultimately what it takes
* Change the PID test logic to just be an echo, because tomcat not quitting when asked is a simple statement of fact
fields.summary: Update shutdown.sh to be more realistic

fields.description:
One of our admins came by today and said that he couldn't create a new project after we upgraded JIRA to 6.0, he never had this problem before. I said "_phe_" and selected projects in the right drop down menu and clicked the "Add Project" button. Nothing happened.
This kind of baffled me so naturally  I started up firebug to see what happened and I saw the following error

{code}
TypeError: this._enableWebSudo is not a function
{code}

It seemed to be an authorization issue but I couldn't figure out why it would happen now after upgrading. I realized, though, that I had never been asked for my admin credentials when going into project so I went in somewhere else in the admin page where authorization was required, filled in my password and after that I could create a project.

So, the problem seems to be that if you go straight to projects and press "Create Project" then nothing happens. There should at least be a message saying "You are not authorized" or something because our admin was really confused.

*How to re-create:*
Go to projects without having authorized yourself as an admin and press Create Project. Nothing will happen.

*Expected result:*
If I'm not authorized to create a project either ask me for my password or tell me I shouldn't press the button. :)

*Workaround*

This can be worked around with either of the following:

    Disable websudo as per our Configuring Secure Administrator Sessions.
    Gain websudo access first by accessing a restricted area of JIRA before attempting to create the project (for example access Administration > System).
fields.summary: Cannot create a project if I haven't got the authorization, but no error is presented

fields.description:
The smiley and thumb emoticons are getting scaled and look bad. Inspecting the page it looks like they are getting set to 20px or 19px when the images themselves are currently 16px. Can we change this?

!emoticons.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Emoticons are getting scaled badly

fields.description: When doing a label search the search results are case sensitive, in that if you have labels 'a' and 'A' and search 'a' only one is returned. This is due to the returned values from the REST call.
fields.summary: Label autocomplete is case-sensitive

fields.description:
I assume this is an existing behaviour but in the Filter results gadget, if an error box is being displayed (due to a deleted filter being used for example) and the gadget is set up to auto refresh then a new message box is rendered each refresh.

I'll leave this to be triaged normally.  It is not a blocker or critical and perhaps it best belongs in the gadget project on EAN.
fields.summary: Repeated error message boxes in gadgets that refresh
Supress "What's New" Dialog Box for Sysadmin Account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34964].
  {panel}

1. Go to Search for Issues
2. Create any type of report
3. Click on Export. We use Excel
4. Once you have it in Excel you will see this small image in the report under Status.

This started about 20 days ago. This little tiny image is causing us all kinds of problems. How can I remove this so it's not exported into our reports?
fields.summary: Recently we started seeing an image in the exported reports under search for Issues

fields.description:
jira-issue-nav-plugin uses in most cases AJS.Navigator.modifierKey() to get the modifier key for shortcut tooltips, but in one case (IssueFieldView/Model) it uses JIRA.Issues.IssueFieldUtil.getAccessKeyModifier()

This function in turn tries extracting the key from an inexistent dom element, and falls back to Alt if not found.
fields.summary: Incorrect modifier key displayed in inline edit submit/cancel button tooltips
